description: Sherrard was shot once in the chest in a hotel parking lot and died at Harborview Medical Center. Jacob Thiel, now 23, was found hiding nearby. He was charged with second-degree murder for allegedly shooting Sherrard because he believed Sherrard had stolen Thiel’s cellphone and other electronics.

Co-workers Garcia and Tapia were having drinks at the Taradise Café, a bar patronized by Merle “Chucky” Buchanan. When Tapia was kicked out for being intoxicated, he struck up a conversation with Buchanan outside while Garcia waited nearby. After about 15 minutes, surveillance footage showed Buchanan shooting Tapia in the face and Garcia in the head before driving away. Buchanan, now 27, turned himself in to police two months later and was charged with two counts of second-degree murder.

A woman who lives near the building where Benegas lived called 911 after finding human remains in a suitcase. The medical examiner determined Benegas died from multiple stab wounds and decapitation. Tukwila police arrested Benegas’ cousin, Rosalio Ramos Ramos, now 38. Ramos, who has been charged with second-degree murder, was in the country illegally and had been previously deported to Honduras four times.

Ayers was tortured, raped and stabbed by a man who, choosing at random, walked into her Lake City house through her unlocked back door. Her killer set her body on fire in an effort to destroy DNA evidence. Seattle police arrested Michael Giordano, now 24, in Pioneer Square. He was charged with aggravated first-degree murder.

Hernandez’s 9-year-old daughter called 911 on Dec. 14, 2017, and reported that her brother, Heriberto Alcantar Hernandez, was strangling and punching their mother. Hernandez, found on the ground outside the house, was airlifted to Harborview Medical Center, where doctors found the blade of a 5-inch knife in her skull. Alcantar, now 21, was arrested at a bus stop a mile from the family home with blood on his hands and clothing. He was initially charged with first-degree assault domestic violence but the charge was amended to second-degree murder domestic violence after his mother was taken off life support. Court records indicate Alcantar has been diagnosed with a serious mental illness and it appears unlikely he will be found competent to stand trial.

Pigford was stabbed multiple times in a Rainier Beach parking lot and died a short time later at Harborview Medical Center. Police interviewed a 34-year-old woman, who returned to the scene and said she had been injured in an altercation with Pigford. King County prosecutors declined to file criminal charges after determining the woman killed Pigford in self-defense.

suspect_name: King County sheriff’s Deputy Leland Adams
description: King County sheriff’s Deputy Leland Adams was looking for parking violators in the garage at Kent Station. He came across a suspicious vehicle and was contacting two men when he was told over his police radio that the car had been reported stolen. Adams tried to arrest the driver, later identified as Hernandez. Hernandez armed himself with an AR-15 rifle and fought with the deputy. Adams fired a single shot, striking Hernandez in the chest. He died a short time later at Harborview Medical Center.

suspect_name: Issaquah police Officers Michael Lucht and Kylen Whittom
description: On Aug. 5, Issaquah police Officers Michael Lucht and Kylen Whittom responded to the apartment Leng shared with his wife for a possible domestic-violence situation after a neighbor called 911 and reported hearing raised voices and items being thrown. When Leng’s wife opened the door, the officers saw Leng holding her from behind and they forced their way in as the door began to close. His widow, who has filed a federal civil-rights lawsuit against the city and officers, claims the officers roughly handled her husband as they handcuffed him, breaking his neck. Leng, who didn’t speak English and suffered from dementia, was immediately taken to an Issaquah hospital where he died a month later.
